db:abstract.db:para: Holds the D3D12 device used by the QRhi.

db:note.db:para: The class uses void * as the type since including the COM-based d3d12.h headers is not acceptable here. The actual types are ID3D12Device * and ID3D12CommandQueue *.
This is a RHI API with limited compatibility guarantees, see QRhi for details.

db:section.db:title: qint32 QRhiD3D12NativeHandles::adapterLuidHigh
db:section.db:para: The high part of the local identifier (LUID) of the DXGI adapter to use. Relevant only when QRhi creates the device, ignored when importing a device and device context.

db:section.db:title: quint32 QRhiD3D12NativeHandles::adapterLuidLow
db:section.db:para: The low part of the local identifier (LUID) of the DXGI adapter to use. Relevant only when QRhi creates the device, ignored when importing a device and device context.

db:section.db:title: void * QRhiD3D12NativeHandles::commandQueue
db:section.db:para: When set, must point to a ID3D12CommandQueue. It allows to optionally import a command queue as well, in addition to a device.

db:section.db:title: void * QRhiD3D12NativeHandles::dev
db:section.db:para: Points to a ID3D12Device or left set to nullptr if no existing device is to be imported.

db:section.db:title: int QRhiD3D12NativeHandles::minimumFeatureLevel
db:section.db:para: Specifies the minimum feature level passed to D3D12CreateDevice(). When not set, D3D_FEATURE_LEVEL_11_0 is used. See this page for details.
Relevant only when QRhi creates the device, ignored when importing a device and device context.
